title: American literature - fiction books from 1800 to 1950
description:
About the collection
====================

This is my collection of American literature from the 18th century to 1950. There are no fantasy and science fiction books, though: those will be the object of a separate torrent.

[b]Formats[/b]
The books are mainly in .epub and .pdf, because I don't own a Kindle and I dislike the very idea of a proprietary format and e-reader which binds you as its slave, in exchange for the low price. I usually go for ereaders which support the greatest number of formats. 

Naming
======

The folders are by authorâ€™s surname. As for the files themselves, my naming convention is different than found in collections that come from Calibre. I donâ€™t like it when the books are by book title and not by author, because then if you donâ€™t have enough books by the same person to make a special author folder, finding what you want is much easier if all works by the same author are grouped together.

Sources
=======

These are not my own scans or OCR. They have been collected over many years from the web, either from huge messy book torrents containing a bit of everything or from free download sites such as gutenberg, and a bunch of them came with my e-readers. 

My only merit is organizing. I picked those which belong to this category from the chaos of most book torrents, and renamed them consistently to prune out doubles and make search easy. Iâ€™ve taken out meaningless folder numbers, deleted .opf and other useless files. In many cases Iâ€™ve added a .txt file with info about authors, added authorâ€™s year of birth and death. 

You might find some books twice: usually because one is a scan of a regular book and the other one with the blown-up font used for e-readers, or sometimes one will include a cover and the other wonâ€™t. .. things like that. The collection is not compressed, so if these things donâ€™t matter to you, feel free to skip downloading one of the two
